transcript: of the kind. We civilians, as you know, have a very bad way of deciding whether a battle was won or lost. Those who retreat after a battle have lost it is what we say; and according to that it is we who lost the battle of Pultiisk. In short, we retreat after the battle but send a courier to Peters- burg with news of a victory, and General Ben- nigsen, hoping to receive from Petersburg the post of commander in chief as a reward for his victory, does not give up the command of the army
